character.appearance: Snow leopard like colors face is some what like if you crossed a human and a tabaxi.
character.bonds: I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.\nAn injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me.

text.p: Prerequisites: Dexterity 13 or higher
You turn an enemy's strength from numbers into your own strength.
Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.

You have an excellent memory for maps and geography, and you can always recall the general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around you. In addition, you can find food and fresh water for yourself and up to five other people each day, provided that the land offers berries, small game, water, and so forth.

At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves' tools) to gain this benefit.

During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.

Starting at 3rd level, you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.
When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement.
In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th and 19th levels, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Starting at 5th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

character.flaws: I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants.\nThere's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
character.ideals: Greater Good. It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)

description.p: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.
Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.
Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.
Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torchor anything else with abundant, exposed fueltakes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.
Trophy from the hellhound he killed. (part of the outlander background)
A Scabbard with a Clockwork inlaid with Pale Gold.
was found in Black Rucksack.
A poison oil made from crudely mixing oil and smashed Sylvan Browns.
DISADVSKILL: perception; ATK: -2 lasts 1 min
After a hit will need to be reapplied as blood makes the crude mixture too diluted to work agen.
Oil based weapon lit on fire for one round if ignited adding fire damage, After one round the poison is removed and the fire is put out.
Only if lit at the end of a round will it last to the end of the turn of the player next round.
Poisons effects can be changed by the dm/gm to suit the game if current effects are deemed to powerful.
A old jug from a past adventure.
Was fixed and is now used to hold large amounts of poison.
was taken off a Hobgoblin that his party killed in a past adventure.

A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.
The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

An arcane focus is a special iteman orb, a crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar itemdesigned to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.
Used to make rope ladder a makeshift bridge.

Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make this save."

A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch (described earlier in this section).
A rope ladder from a past adventure. has 2 Pitons on one end, Shaft of Oak can be use to make it a makeshift bridge that can span no larger then 30 feet.

As an action, you can spend a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.
While you wear this ring, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce your speed nor cause you to be paralyzed or restrained.

This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and 3 vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing .

These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

id-00042.name: Eyes of the Eagle
id-00042.nonidentified: Two crystal lenses bound together with a little bit of wire.

description.p: You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00043.name: Potion of Healing
id-00043.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

description.p: We need more test subjects! collect some more and bring them to our colloseum.

link.b: Syrinscape : Robe Swoosh - Wizard Spells E

description.p: This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it. While wearing the robe, you can use an action to detach one of the patches, causing it to become the object or creature it represents. Once the last patch is removed, the robe becomes an ordinary garment.
The robe has two of each of the following patches:
In addition, the robe has 4d4 other patches. The
GM chooses the patches or determines them randomly.

linklist.link: Pit (a cube 10 feet on a side), which you can place on the ground within 10 feet of you
Pit (a cube 10 feet on a side), which you can place on the ground within 10 feet of you
Scroll of Protection from Evil and Good

tr.td: Silver coffer (1 foot long, 6 inches wide and deep) worth 500 GP
Iron door (up to 10 feet wide and 10 feet high, barred on one side of your choice), which you can place in an opening you can reach; it conforms to fit the opening, attaching and hinging itself
A riding horse with saddle bags
Pit (a cube 10 feet on a side), which you can place on the ground within 10 feet of you
Spell scroll containing one spell of 1st to 3rd level
Window (2 feet by 4 feet, up to 2 feet deep), which you can place on a vertical surface you can reach

description.p: A poisoner's kit includes the 5 vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

character.name: Jade Snowpaw
character.notes:
Current Obsession: Magic item
Current Major Obsession: Location Underdark or equivalet of it.
Tabaxi Quirk: You are a font of random trivia from the lore and stories you have discovered.

has lived a life in the wilds with his wandering tribe, in his teenage years they hade a run in with a warzone area wile trying to avoide it they sadly ran into one of the warbands of the invading forces and all of his tripe was wiped out but him.

Jade has been on two other advenures before getting to the nexus he had been on two other adventures.

On his first adventure he found his jug soon after he and his party were attacked by hell hounds that they defeated.

On his second adventure him and his party has to cross a chasm using a rope ladder that hobgoblins were using to cross it, after killing and looting the hobgoblins the party went down the road and found two caves.

one of them was a crystal cave that leads leads to the underdark his obsession at the time was a location seeing the wonders of this cave only for a short while it has caused a major obsession with the underdark.

the other cave was a short cut to the destination of tha party where he found the poison mushrooms he used to make a simple oil based poison, in the cave they fought off two trees an after finished the job.

Jade left the party at some point after study of what he can find about the underdark, he went back to the cave while stealthing he saw a party run into a portal not realizing they where running from monsters he went to have a closer look and then realized he had to choice but to follow that party into the portal to live.

now after living in the nexus and having most of his gold spent living and finding out about his new strange predicament he is ready to go back out investigating the larger existence of everything .
Notes:
has seen a warblessed goblin

Duergar note:
We need more test subjects! collect some more and bring them to our colloseum.

The city of Tavii will rise up and overcome the overlanders and their coloseum will flow with the blood of the overlanders

knows of poison ahuad fruit blue
The Ahuad is a shrub growing about 7 inches high. It has broad leaves that have complex stems holding multiple leaves. Each leaf has 6 lobes with bumpy edges.

Eating all of the fruit of the Ahuad inflicts 4 d6 poison damage . Unless otherwise preserved, the fruit will spoil after 10 days (the more powerful the fruit the harder it is to preserve).

mix with alchohol it paralyzes.

people : gont the dwarf, Drysdalynn, Armash son of Iorturim of Clan Thuuccucwants pigment
character.personalitytraits: I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.\nI have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.

id-00001.label: Second-Story Work; [DEX] ft added to running jump and climb at normal speed

description.p: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to climb faster than normal-climbing no longer costs you extra movement.
In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.
A poison oil made from crudely mixing oil and smashed Sylvan Browns.
DISADVSKILL: perception; ATK: -2 lasts 1 min
After a hit will need to be reapplied as blood makes the crude mixture too diluted to work agen.
Oil based weapon lit on fire for one round if ignited adding fire damage, After one round the poison is removed and the fire is put out.
Only if lit at the end of a round will it last to the end of the turn of the player next round.
Poisons effects can be changed by the dm/gm to suit the game if current effects are deemed to powerful.
You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

id-00006.name: Item: Potion of Healing
id-00006.nonidentified: A vial of red liquid that shimmers when agitated.

description.p: You regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

id-00007.name: Item: Potion of Greater Healing
id-00007.nonidentified: A vial of red liquid that shimmers when agitated.

description.p: You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

id-00008.name: Item: Potion of Superior Healing
id-00008.nonidentified: A vial of red liquid that shimmers when agitated.

description.p: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

You can lend your aid to another creature in the completion of a task. When you take the Help action, the creature you aid gains advantage on the next ability check it makes to perform the task you are helping with, pjrovided that it makes the check before the start of your next turn.

When you take the Hide action, you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check in an attempt to hide, following the rules in chapter 7 for hiding. If you succeed, you gain certain benefits, as described in the "Unseen Attackers and Targets" section later in this chapter.

Sometimes you want to get the jump on a foe or wait for a particular circumstance before you act. To do so, you can take the Ready action on your turn so that you can act later in the round using your reaction. For more information see "Actions in Combat, Ch 9"
You regain 10d4 + 20 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.
Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

id-00013.name: Item: Potion of Supreme Healing
id-00013.nonidentified: A vial of red liquid that shimmers when agitated.

description.p: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make this save."
Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

id-00001.label: Hooded Lanter; Bright light to 30' dim light to 60'; Dim light 5' with hood lowered

description.p: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

id-00001.label: Bullseye Lantern; Bright light to 60' dim light to 120'

description.p: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

id-00005.label: Oil; Additional damage if fire damage taken

description.p: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

id-00002.label: Torch; Bright light to 20' dim light to 40'

description.p: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

id-00003.label: Caltrops; Walking speed redcued 10 ft. until reagaining at least 1 HP

description.p: As an action, you can spend a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

id-00001.name: Tool: One type of musical instrument

id-00002.name: Weapon: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords

text.p: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing .

Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.
You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
